required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: LHA510 Proof-of-Concept Study as a Maintenance Therapy for Patients With Wet Age-Related Macular Degeneration
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Masked, Vehicle-Controlled Proof-Of-Concept Study for Topically Delivered LHA510 as a Maintenance Therapy in Patients With Wet Age-Related Macular Degeneration (AMD)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of 84 successive days of topically administered LHA510 compared to vehicle in reducing the number of patients requiring intravitreal (IVT) anti-vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) therapy (Lucentis®) for recurrence of active choroidal neovascularization (CNV).

detailed_description.textblock: On Day -1, patients will receive an IVT Lucentis® injection in the study eye, and then will be randomized to receive either topical LHA510 ophthalmic suspension or vehicle in a 1:1 ratio for 84 days. Patients with recurrence of active CNV in the study eye during the study will receive rescue IVT Lucentis® injections. Following the treatment period, subjects will return for a follow-up visit and a disposition visit. Only one eye (designated as the study eye) will be dosed with either topical LHA510 or vehicle per patient.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Positive LUCENTIS® Retreatment Status at Day 84
primary_outcome.description: For subjects who completed the Day 84 visit, retreatment need status was positive if LUCENTIS® retreatment (injection) was required before or at Day 84, including requiring retreatment at or before the Day 84 visit with the actual retreatment performed at a later visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First LUCENTIS® Retreatment Need Identification up to Day 84
secondary_outcome.description: The time was determined based on the visit of the treatment period when a patient was identified as requiring retreatment with LUCENTIS.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of LUCENTIS® Retreatment Needs Identified Required up to Day 84
secondary_outcome.description: The number of LUCENTIS retreatment needs identified before or at the Day 84 visit (even if retreatment was applied at a later visit) for each patient was used in the analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Requiring LUCENTIS® Retreatment at Days 28 and 56
secondary_outcome.description: The number of LUCENTIS® retreatment needs identified before or at the Day 28 and Day 56 visits (even if retreatment was applied at a later visit) for each subject was used in the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Randomization Visit (Day -1) in Central Subfield Thickness Total (CSFTtot) at All Visits at the Study Site
secondary_outcome.description: The thickness of the retina was measured using SD-OCT and reported as a difference, in micrometers, between a given post-Randomization Visit and Randomization Visit (Day-1). A negative number indicates a reduction in thickness, whereas a positive number indicates an increase. An increase in thickness may indicate a progression of the underlying disease. Only one eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Randomization Visit (Day -1) in Best Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA) at All Visits at the Study Site
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of best corrected (with spectacles or other visual corrective devices) visual acuity was conducted in each eye individually using ETDRS charts and reported in number of letters read correctly. An increase (gain) in letters read from the baseline assessment indicates improvement. Only one eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Randomization Visit (Day -1) in Central Subfield Thickness, Neuro-retina (CSFTnr) by Visit
secondary_outcome.description: The thickness of the neuro-retina, at the level of the central subfield, was measured using SD-OCT and reported as a difference, in micrometers, between a given post-Randomization Visit and Randomization Visit (Day-1). A negative number indicates a reduction in thickness, whereas a positive number indicates an increase. An increase in thickness may indicate a progression of the underlying disease. Only one eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Randomization Visit (Day -1) in Lesion Thickness by Visit
secondary_outcome.description: The thickness of the neovascular lesion was measured using SD-OCT and reported as a difference, in micrometers, between a given post-Randomization Visit and Randomization Visit (Day-1). A negative number indicates a reduction in thickness, whereas a positive number indicates an increase. An increase in thickness of the neovascular lesion may indicate a progression of the underlying disease. Only one eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Randomization Visit (Day -1) in Subretinal Fluid - Foveal Involvement (SRFfi) Thickness by Visit
secondary_outcome.description: The thickness of subretinal fluid involving the fovea was measured using SD-OCT and reported as a difference, in micrometers, between a given post-Randomization Visit and Randomization Visit (Day-1). A negative number indicates a reduction in thickness, whereas a positive number indicates an increase. An increase in thickness of subretinal fluid involving the fovea may indicate a progression of the underlying disease. Only one eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Randomization Visit (Day -1) in Pigment Epithelial Detachment - Foveal Involvement (PEDfi) Thickness by Visit
secondary_outcome.description: The thickness of pigment epithelial detachment involving the fovea was measured using SD-OCT and reported as a difference, in micrometers, between a given post-Randomization Visit and Randomization Visit (Day-1). A negative number indicates a reduction in thickness, whereas a positive number indicates an increase. An increase in thickness of pigment epithelial detachment involving the fovea may indicate a progression of the underlying disease. Only one eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Randomization Visit (Day -1) in Total Lesion Size by Visit
secondary_outcome.description: The total wet AMD lesion size was measured using FA and reported as a difference, in millimeter squared, between a given post-Randomization Visit and Randomization Visit (Day-1). A negative number indicates a reduction, whereas a positive number indicates an increase. An increase in wet AMD lesion size may indicate a progression of the underlying disease. Only one eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Randomization Visit (Day -1) in CNV Size by Visit
secondary_outcome.description: The size of CNV (area of new blood vessels in the choroid layer of the retina) was measured using FA and reported as a difference, in millimeter squared, between a given post-Randomization Visit and Randomization Visit (Day-1). A negative number indicates a reduction, whereas a positive number indicates an increase. An increase in CNV size may indicate a progression of the underlying disease. Only one eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentration of LHA510 and CRA398
secondary_outcome.description: Samples collected from subjects, after multiple topical ocular dosing of LHA510, were analyzed to determine concentrations of LHA510 and its metabolite, CRA398. Plasma LHA510 and CRA398 concentrations were quantitated by a validated liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectroscopy assay method. Below the limit of quantification (BLQ) is treated as zero.

arm_group.description: LHA510 ophthalmic suspension administered topically in the study eye as specified in the protocol for 84 days, with ranibizumab ophthalmic solution for IVT injection as standard of care rescue therapy.
LHA510 vehicle administered topically in the study eye as specified in the protocol for 84 days, with ranibizumab ophthalmic solution for IVT injection as standard of care rescue therapy.

intervention.description: Inactive ingredients used as a placebo comparator

overall_official.affiliation: Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research, Inc.

facility.name: Contact Alcon Call Center for Trial Locations

patient_data.ipd_description: Novartis is committed to sharing with qualified external researchers, access to patient-level data and supporting clinical documents from eligible studies. These requests are reviewed and approved by an independent review panel on the basis of scientific merit. All data provided is anonymized to respect the privacy of patients who have participated in the trial in line with applicable laws and regulations. This trial data availability is according to the criteria and process described on www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited from 20 study centers located in the United States.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 136 enrolled, 37 subjects were exited as screen failures and another 6 subjects were discontinued prior to randomization. This reporting group includes all randomized subjects (93).

group.title: LHA510
group.description: LHA510 ophthalmic suspension administered topically in the study eye as specified in the protocol for 84 days, with ranibizumab ophthalmic solution for IVT injection as standard of care rescue therapy.

group.title: Vehicle
group.description: LHA510 vehicle administered topically in the study eye as specified in the protocol for 84 days, with ranibizumab ophthalmic solution for IVT injection as standard of care rescue therapy.

baseline.population: This analysis population includes all subjects who received any dose of investigational product (IP) (Safety Analysis Set).

group.title: LHA510
group.description: LHA510 ophthalmic suspension administered topically in the study eye as specified in the protocol for 84 days, with ranibizumab ophthalmic solution for IVT injection as standard of care rescue therapy.

group.title: Vehicle
group.description: LHA510 vehicle administered topically in the study eye as specified in the protocol for 84 days, with ranibizumab ophthalmic solution for IVT injection as standard of care rescue therapy.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male
Central Subfield Thickness Total (CSFTtot)
measure.description: The thickness of the retina was measured using spectral domain-optical coherence tomography (SD-OCT) and reported in micrometers.
measure.population: All subjects who met amendment 4 entry criteria, received any dose of IP, had at least 1 follow-up visit with an assessment for primary endpoint, and had no critical protocol deviations, or discontinued the study due to lack of efficacy or tolerability before Day 84 (Extended PPS-A4).

measure.title: Best-corrected visual acuity (BCVA)
measure.description: Measurement of best corrected (with spectacles or other visual corrective devices) visual acuity was conducted in each eye individually using Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) charts and reported in number of letters read correctly.

measure.title: Central Subfield Thickness Neuro-Retina (CSFTnr)
measure.description: The thickness of the neuro-retina, at the level of the central subfield, was measured using SD-OCT and reported in micrometers.

measure.title: Lesion Thickness
measure.description: The thickness of the neovascular lesion was measured using SD-OCT and reported in micrometers.

measure.title: Subretinal Fluid-Foveal Involvement (SRFfi) Thickness
measure.description: The thickness of subretinal fluid involving the fovea was measured using SD-OCT and reported in micrometers.

measure.title: Pigment Epithelial Detachment – Foveal Involvement (PEDfi) Thickness
measure.description: The thickness of pigment epithelial detachment involving the fovea was measured using SD-OCT and reported in micrometers.

measure.title: Total Lesion Size
measure.description: The total neovascular lesion size was measured by fluorescein angiography (FA) assessment and reported in millimeters squared.

measure.title: Choroidal Neovascularization (CNV) Size
measure.description: CNV (creation of new blood vessels in the choroid layer of the eye) size as measured by FA assessment and reported in millimeters squared.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Positive LUCENTIS® Retreatment Status at Day 84
outcome.description: For subjects who completed the Day 84 visit, retreatment need status was positive if LUCENTIS® retreatment (injection) was required before or at Day 84, including requiring retreatment at or before the Day 84 visit with the actual retreatment performed at a later visit.

outcome.title: Change From Randomization Visit (Day -1) in Central Subfield Thickness Total (CSFTtot) at All Visits at the Study Site
outcome.description: The thickness of the retina was measured using SD-OCT and reported as a difference, in micrometers, between a given post-Randomization Visit and Randomization Visit (Day-1). A negative number indicates a reduction in thickness, whereas a positive number indicates an increase. An increase in thickness may indicate a progression of the underlying disease. Only one eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.
outcome.population: Extended PPS-A4. Missing data imputed using the Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) approach.

outcome.title: Plasma Concentration of LHA510 and CRA398
outcome.description: Samples collected from subjects, after multiple topical ocular dosing of LHA510, were analyzed to determine concentrations of LHA510 and its metabolite, CRA398. Plasma LHA510 and CRA398 concentrations were quantitated by a validated liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectroscopy assay method. Below the limit of quantification (BLQ) is treated as zero.
outcome.population: This analysis population includes all subjects who were treated with LHA510, had at least 1 serum sample following exposure to the IP, and had no known specimen collection or analytical deviations, as identified by the Pharmacokineticist, that would have affected the integrity of the data [Pharmacokinetics (PK) Analysis Set].

group.title: LHA510
group.description: LHA510 dose twice daily (BID) by Day 28, LHA510 dose once daily (QD) by Day 84, LHA510 dose 3-times daily (TID) by Day 84

group.title: CRA398
group.description: Metabolite of LHA510

measure.title: Plasma Concentration of LHA510 and CRA398
measure.description: Samples collected from subjects, after multiple topical ocular dosing of LHA510, were analyzed to determine concentrations of LHA510 and its metabolite, CRA398. Plasma LHA510 and CRA398 concentrations were quantitated by a validated liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectroscopy assay method. Below the limit of quantification (BLQ) is treated as zero.
measure.population: This analysis population includes all subjects who were treated with LHA510, had at least 1 serum sample following exposure to the IP, and had no known specimen collection or analytical deviations, as identified by the Pharmacokineticist, that would have affected the integrity of the data [Pharmacokinetics (PK) Analysis Set].

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events (AEs) were collected from time of consent for the duration of a subject’s participation in the study (up to 177 days). AEs are reported as pre-treatment, treatment-emergent, and post-treatment.
reported_events.desc: An AE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a subject who was administered a study treatment regardless of whether or not the event had a causal relationship with the treatment. AEs were obtained through solicited and spontaneous comments from subjects and through observations by the Investigator as outlined in the study protocol.

group.title: Pre-treatment
group.description: All subjects with AE/s reported prior to the initiation of IP administration

group.title: LHA510
group.description: All subjects with AE/s having an onset from IP initiation and up through 7 days after cessation of IP administration

group.title: Vehicle
group.description: All subjects with AE/s having an onset from IP initiation and up through 7 days after cessation of IP administration

group.title: Post-treatment LHA510
group.description: All subjects with AE/s having an onset more than 7 days after IP administration cessation through the study exit

group.title: Post-treatment Vehicle
group.description: All subjects with AE/s having an onset more than 7 days after IP administration cessation through the study exit

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Sponsor reserves the right of prior review of any publication or presentation of information related to the study.
